# AnyCancellable

**Class**

A type-erasing cancellable object that executes a provided closure when canceled.

## Declaration

```swift
final class AnyCancellable
```

## Overview

Subscriber implementations can use this type to provide a “cancellation token” that makes it possible for a caller to cancel a publisher, but not to use the [doc://com.apple.Combine/documentation/Combine/Subscription] object to request items.

An [doc://com.apple.Combine/documentation/Combine/AnyCancellable] instance automatically calls [doc://com.apple.Combine/documentation/Combine/Cancellable/cancel()] when deinitialized.

## Creating a type-erased cancellable

- **init(_:)**: Initializes the cancellable object with the given cancel-time closure.
- **init(_:)**

## Storing instances

- **store(in:)**: Stores this type-erasing cancellable instance in the specified collection.
- **store(in:)**: Stores this type-erasing cancellable instance in the specified set.

## Operators

- **==(_:_:)**: Returns a Boolean value that indicates whether two instances are equal, as determined by comparing whether their references point to the same instance.

## Publishers

- **Publisher**: Declares that a type can transmit a sequence of values over time.
- **Publishers**: A namespace for types that serve as publishers.
- **AnyPublisher**: A publisher that performs type erasure by wrapping another publisher.
- **Published**: A type that publishes a property marked with an attribute.
- **Cancellable**: A protocol indicating that an activity or action supports cancellation.

## Conforms To

- Cancellable
- Equatable
- Hashable
